content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

Simple Social Icons v2.0 beta, a new theme from Susan Ramsey, and your best Genesis ‘newbie’ moments.

Themes

Susan Ramsey with a colourful new theme, Happy School Days (Demo), aimed at teachers and educators.

Buy your teacher the best Christmas gift! Announcing the release of Happy School Days – a brand new #GenesisWP theme https://t.co/e8UpUqLgZO pic.twitter.com/r0owP1BIOO

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) November 30, 2016

And Susan also gives some hints on her next theme.

I was just talking to @TheCre8tiveDiva about what I used to do before I found my hobby (#GenesisWP) – I was an avid cross-stitcher. pic.twitter.com/Dryn4IaNeY

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) December 3, 2016

This reminds me that my next #GenesisWP theme is going to be designed for crafters, since that was my background @TheCre8tiveDiva

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) December 3, 2016

Calvin Koepke with an update on his latest theme.

I was able to build some #genesiswp goodness over the holiday, too: pic.twitter.com/jakR9ZIfbJ

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) November 28, 2016

Showcase

Works Progress with a stunning new site for vibecreativedistrict.org

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, stunning new showcase site by @worksprogress built on their #genesiswp starter theme https://t.co/zSSbeOsTVM pic.twitter.com/KtSdlPsgV7

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) November 28, 2016

Not content with just releasing a new theme, Susan Ramsey updated her website as well and it looks great, onehappystudio.com

I had a very productive five day weekend. In addition to releasing a new #GenesisWP theme, I also revamped my site https://t.co/B2MXeSwBQJ pic.twitter.com/cUe4nnTQbc

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) November 30, 2016

Carrie Loves with a stylish new site for tarrynfisher.com

So excited to announce the launch of @Tarryn__Fisher new website design. Built on #WordPress #GenesisWP with customized Hello Darling theme. pic.twitter.com/bZvQNPdqMn

— carrie loves (@carrieloves) November 30, 2016

Open Waves Design with their first client site on Genesis (congrats!) for caitymacneill.com

Launched a new client site today! My first one using #GenesisWP from @studiopress.https://t.co/E1KphN3JM6

— Open Waves Design (@openwavesdesign) December 1, 2016

Sacha Benda for luxurylabcosmetics.it

Happy to announce New Website for Luxury Lab Cosmetics built on #genesiswp with quite a few customizations! https://t.co/uTGEs08qil pic.twitter.com/o3QyiazwPA

— Sacha Benda (@saxisme) December 1, 2016

And two quick ones from the Genesis Slack #showcase channel (you are on Genesis Slack, right?).

  • Shaan Nicol for thewishlane.com, and
  • Vaughan Simons for honoroakbark.co.uk

Podcasts

The latest episode of rethink.fm sees two of my favourite WordPress people brought together. With Jackie D’Elia chatting with Kim Doyal (who many of you will know as the WP Chick)

Ep 9 Acres of Diamonds: Finding gems right in your own backyard with @kimdoyal #WordPress https://t.co/LPXtwjJGuT via @rethinkfm

— Rethink FM (@rethinkfm) December 1, 2016

While over on OfficeHours.fm, Carrie chats with Cody Landefeld on being a WordPress generalist vs a specialist.

Featured on the @officehoursfm podcast with @cdils
Discussed #WooCommerce & how enterprise is using #WordPresshttps://t.co/SMgFKyIn1c pic.twitter.com/jwg88964OQ

— Cody Landefeld (@codyL) November 28, 2016

Best of the rest

Simple Social Icons, the popular WordPress plugin from StudioPress, saw v2.0 beta shared with the world this week.

Featuring new icons, a switch to SVGs instead of icon fonts, and a few other under the hood tweaks. Read about it in the offical update post.

Big changes here. Significant improvements. Take note! https://t.co/dcLqGgY6fy

— Robin Cornett (@robincornett) December 1, 2016

If you’ve been thinking of buying the GBeaver theme, probably best to grab it now before the price goes up:

Guys next week I am going to increase the price of GBeaver #genesiswp child theme. I am giving the last chance for interested people.

— Beaver World (@wpbeaverworld) December 2, 2016

If you didn’t catch it live, check out this great round-up of Matt Mullenweg’s State of the Word 2016 speech by Brian Krogsgard over at Post Status. Particularly interesting, the ‘No major releases’ in 2017 section.

New: Matt Mullenweg State of the Word, 2016 #wcus https://t.co/fcMSEIyKkh pic.twitter.com/CfbLQxUPem

— Post Status (@post_status) December 3, 2016

And finally…

Same great tweets from the community this week on people’s newbie moments with Genesis.

That time you remember when you were a newbie to #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/D3Rqfsg6Z9

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) December 3, 2016

One thing that made me laugh yesterday, this email to/from @studiopress from 2009. OMG have I come a long way. How Funny! #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/1KThKNLyba

— Anita C. (@TheCre8tiveDiva) December 3, 2016

Do you have a Genesis newbie moment to share?

That’s all for this week, I’ll be back next week with more gems from the community.

Till then, let’s keep Genesis awesome.

PS Not already subscriber? Subscribe below, support what I’m doing and feel awesome (all the same time).

excerpt.rendered: Simple Social Icons v2.0 beta, a new theme from Susan Ramsey, and your best Genesis ‘newbie’ moments.
